chosen: The average response to an intruder, whether they have a weapon or not, is to leave the scene immediately. This is called the “castle doctrine”. rejected: In most jurisdictions in the US and Europe, the most common law is that it is not justified to use deadly force to defend property, unless the intruder is armed. It is also generally legal to use deadly force to defend your property in the US, but only if you feel that the intruder has threatened your life. For example, it would be illegal for a homeowner to kill an intruder who has entered their house and broken a few items, as long as the intruder had not threatened to harm the homeowner in any way.
